content:
While working on #documentation > color of code elements, I noticed that both the Linkifers and Code playground tabs in the Organization settings overlay have big blocks of explanatory text at the top with some examples as inline code tags. The text on these overlays doesn't have the rendered_markdown class, which means the examples in the HTML code tags are being styled a little differently than what is in messages.

Linkifiers tab, Code playgrounds tab

I guess some questions I have are:

  • Do we feel all this text is helpful on this page?
  • Would a short sentence (like most other tabs in this overlay) with a link to the help center documentation be enough?
  • Would some sort of tooltip / popover work for some of the information?

Also, I'll note here that one of the current examples in the Linifiers tab doesn't work well on narrowed windows.

Screenshot-from-2023-02-22-18-14-55.png

Hm, I don't think I'd want to go in the direction of hiding the documentation here (in tooltips or by linking out to it), because I don' t think these panels are usable without it, at least not the first time you do it. Especially for linkfiers.

If we were to try to simplify, I'd think more in the direction of trying to come up with an interactive widget that helps you put together the final result, like we did for generating a stream email with all the appropriate tags.

What about some editing down of the text and having only one example (plus links to the relevant help center articles)? Here are some rough draft screenshots ...

Linkifiers tab:
Screenshot-from-2023-02-23-15-40-01.png Screenshot-from-2023-02-23-15-39-43.png

Code playgrounds tab:
Screenshot-from-2023-02-23-16-00-31.png Screenshot-from-2023-02-23-16-00-15.png
Sure, that direction seems reasonable to me; it will be easiest to make suggestions for further wording tweaks on a PR.
